result.execSummary:
The defendant Allen L Ammon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine and costs to be paid at $40.00 per month commencing 9/1/16 and each month thereafter or penalty of 5 days Huber, for non-payment.

Costs to be paid along with fine.
**Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.  Defendant must Petition the Court in writing upon successful completion of the sentence.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Allen L Ammon

defendant.name: Ammon, Allen L

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Allen L Ammon in court with attorney Adam J. Schleis.  Jayne Davis Dewire appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant enters a plea of guilty to count #1.   Court finds the defendant guilty to count #1.  
State makes recommendations regarding sentencing.  Attorney Schleis makes statements to the Court and requests expunction of this case.  Defendant makes statements to the Court.  

The Court Orders the Following to count #1:
FINE: $316.00

DNA Surcharge: $200.00

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
 
Total costs/fine/forfeiture: to be paid at the rate of $40 per month commencing 9/1/16.  Failure to pay;  the Court orders the defendant to serve 5 days in Huber.

Expunction is conditionally granted upon completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.  Defendant must Petition the Court in writing upon successful completion of the sentence.
Bail/bond hearing on July 14, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Case called at 10:55 am. Attorney Adam J. Schleis in court.   Defendant Allen L Ammon did not appear.  Attorney Schleis does not know why the Defendant does not appear. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Bond is revoked and forfeited. Capias to issue. Bail is $300.00.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 1, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Defendant Allen L Ammon in court with attorney Adam J. Schleis.  Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 1, 2016 at 10:30 am.
dated February 16, 2016 Request for adjournment filed by defendant/defense counsel from Atty Adam Schleis

Defendant Allen L Ammon in court with attorney Adam Schleis as a friend to the court. Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Discovery handed out in court.  Hearing scheduled for March 7, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant is not to have any violent contact with victim/witness listed in the criminal complaint.   Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

Defendant Allen L Ammon in court.  Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court advises of right to an attorney.   Defendant to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for February 5, 2016 at 09:30 am.
